roleset.name: smell by inhaling through the nose
roleset.note: WHIFF-V NOTES: Roleset based on internet search. Member of Vncls 35.3. Comparison to ?smell?. Roleset by Julia. (from whiff.01-v)

example.name: All args
example.text: Discreetly, I whiffed the air for tequila or petroleum.

example.name: Scent as core arg
example.text: Her expression seemed to say she had whiffed a very bad odor.

example.name: location as subject
example.text: The air whiffed of pine and peat.

roleset.name: carry on/as a puff of air
roleset.note: WHIFF-V NOTES: Roleset based on internet search. No Vncls. Comparison to ?blow?. Roleset by Julia. (from whiff.02-v)

role.descr: thing being carried on the wind

example.name: All args
example.text: The gust of air whiffed away the clouds.

example.name: Theme as subject with source
example.text: A spurt of smoke whiffed out from her quarter.

roleset.name: swing at and miss the third pitch, striking out
roleset.note: WHIFF-V NOTES: Roleset based on internet search. No Vncls. Comparison to ?fail.01?. Roleset by Julia. (from whiff.03-v)

roles.note: May be used metaphorically. Instances with actual agent rare. (from whiff.03-v)

example.name: With agent
example.text: Chamberlain whiffed the first two Phillies hitters.

example.name: Baseball frame, Args-1&2
example.text: Crane-1 made two fouls, and then sent Chipper into real convulsions by *trace*-1 whiffing at a high one.

example.name: Metaphorical extension, Args-1&2
example.text: John McCain whiffed his own chance to ask Obama about Ayers on live TV.
example.arg: his own chance to ask Obama about Ayers on live TV.

example.name: Arg-2 with PP 'on __'
example.text: The commission whiffed on its duty to protect investors.
example.arg: on its duty to protect investors.

example.name: Baseball frame intransitive
example.text: [Cincy defenders]-1 had Lewis behind the line of scrimmage on third down, and once again *trace*-1 whiffed.

example.name: Metaphorical use intransitive
example.text: [A White House spokesman]-1 started playing hardball with Bill O'Reilly and wound up *trace*-1 whiffing big time.

roleset.name: smoke recreationally, as a pipe
roleset.note: WHIFF-V NOTES: Roleset based on internet search. No Vncls. Comparison to ?smoke?. Roleset by Julia. (from whiff.04-v)

example.name: Arg1 as core arg
example.text: The old man whiffed a pipe.

example.name: Antipassive: Arg-1 as oblique arg
example.text: As usual, he was whiffing at a cigarette.

roleset.name: exhale a puff of air, possibly as an utterance
roleset.note: WHIFF-V NOTES: Roleset based on internet search. Member of Vncls 40.1.3-1. Roleset by Julia. (from whiff.05-v)

example.name: Both args
example.text: They whiffed out a protective prayer or two.

example.name: Both args
example.text: The stranger whiffed out a long, leisurely sort of indifferent and charitable puff.
example.arg: a long, leisurely sort of indifferent and charitable puff.

roleset.name: extinguish
roleset.note: WHIFF-V NOTES: Roleset based on internet search. No Vncls. Comparison to ?extinguish?. Roleset by Julia. (from whiff.06-v)

example.name: Both args
example.text: A beam of destruction whiffed out of existence the pilot, gunnery and the men before them.
example.arg: the pilot, gunnery and the men before them.

example.name: patient as subject
example.text: He had simply whiffed out of existence like a soap bubble.

example.name: Passive
example.text: The people were whiffed out by one breath of armistice!
